instructions:
Preheat 2 individual serving dishes in a 300 F oven. Fry bacon, crumble and set aside in oven. Sauté
green pepper in 1 tbsp bacon grease for 4 minutes; add onion and sauté for an additional 6 minutes. Drain
and set aside with bacon.
In a small aluminum saucepan combine 1/2 tbsp melted margarine, Worcestershire, Red Hot sauce and
salt. Add bacon, green pepper and onion and stir for a few minutes over burner to re-warm. Return sauce
pan to oven.
Fork oysters through fingers looking for shell pieces. Place on paper towel and pat dry. In a 2 quart
saucepan, over high heat, melt remaining margarine *(do not scorch)*. Add oysters and toss lightly with a fork
until edges begin to curl. They should remain plump. Remove from heat. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Drain
well with a slotted spoon, transfer to warm serving dishes and top with bacon and vegetables.
Serve with lemon wedges. Serves 2. 
*(Rev. 2/25/93)*
name: Oysters Casino
creator: Jim Decker
